questions.question: Both the Proclamation of 1763 and Quebec Act of 1774

choices.answer: interfered with colonial claims to western lands
extended religious freedom to Catholics
were repealed after colonial protests
imposed new taxes on goods imported from Europe

questions.question: The Albany Plan of Union

choices.answer: was vetoed by British because it challenged royal authority
United Anglo-Americans during French & Indian War but fell apart
was not implemented but set a precedent for future plans to unite
was the earliest British attempt to suppress colonial assemblies

questions.question: Which helped convince the delegates to the 2nd Continental Congress to vote for independence?

choices.answer: unexpected success of colonists clearing British troops out of New England
Thomas Paine's Common Sense
the Boston Massacre
John Dickinson's Letters from a Pennsylvania Farmer

questions.question: In the Declaratory Act, Parliament stated that

choices.answer: it had right to legislate for the colonies in all matters
colonists were in rebellion and subject to martial law
repeal all Townshend duties except the one on tea
take over payment of the salaries of the royal governors

questions.question: Which of these events occurred last?

choices.answer: the Battle of Bunker Hill
fighting at Lexington and Concord
adoption of the Declaration of Independence
the Boston Massacre

questions.question: How did the French and Indian War differ from King Williams' and King George's Wars?

choices.answer: In French & Indian War, France rather than Spain was British enemy
Americans participated only in the French & Indian War
French & Indian War only one where Indians sided with the French
France lost her empire in North America

questions.question: The chief reason for the repeal of the Stamp Act and the Townshend duties by Parliament was the

choices.answer: conviction that the colonists were on verge of revolution
pleas of Pitt to allow colonists to tax themselves
colonial boycotts and nonimportation agreements
colonial assemblies would voluntarily vote for higher taxes

questions.question: Americans objected to the Tea Act because

choices.answer: it raised the price they had to pay for tea
there was still a tax on tea and it paid salaries for royal governors
it forced them to drink tea rather than coffee
it forced them to buy overpriced tea from British East India Co

questions.question: The Declaration of Independence was primarily written by

choices.answer: John Adams
Patrick Henry
John Hancock
Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: John Adams, a key figure in the Revolution,

choices.answer: drafted letter to legislatures condemning Townshend Duties
started committees of correspondance
served as lawyer for Boston Massacre soldiers
started protest meeting before Boston Tea Party

questions.question: Which of the following statements about the Revolutionary War is correct?

choices.answer: Fighting ended with Cornwallis's surrender at Yorktown
Help from all Native American tribes enabled Americans to win
Most soldiers were drafted into the Continental Army
American victory at Charleston was turning point

questions.question: The Northwest Ordinance did all of the following except

choices.answer: forbid slavery in the Northwest territory
permit territory citizens to make their own laws
permit territory citizens to apply to Congress for statehood
remove Native Americans

questions.question: The British justified their refusal to evacuate their forts in Ohio Valley after war b/c

choices.answer: America failed to stop Indian attacks against Canada
America failed to pay for damage done to British shipping
America failed to return or pay for Loyalists' property
America failed to allow British goods to enter the U.S.

questions.question: Shay's Rebellion was provoked by

choices.answer: retention of the northwest posts by Britain
the failure of the gov't to protect frontier settlements
an excise tax imposed on whiskey
heavy burden of taxes on farmers of Western Massachusetts

questions.question: Which of the following was both an author of U.S. Constitution and supporter of ratification?

choices.answer: Thomas Jefferson
Patrick Henry
James Madison
George Clinton

questions.question: The greatest achievement of the Anti-Federalists was to

choices.answer: force Federalists to add a Bill of Rights
convince NY and VA to turn over western lands to fed. gov't
citizenship to free blacks
women's suffrage

questions.question: All of the following were true of the state constitutions adopted during the Revolution EXCEPT

choices.answer: provided for weak executives and frequent elections
they concentrated power in the popularly elected legislature
they all contained Bills of Rights
abolished property and tax-paying qualifications for voting

questions.question: The main purpose of the Alien and Sedition Acts was to

choices.answer: publicize the activities of French revolutionaries in U.S.
strengthen the policy of neutrality
strengthen the Democratic Republican Party
suppress the Democratic Republican opposition to Federalist policies

questions.question: Hamilton wanted federal gov't to takeover all war debts of the states b/c he believed that

choices.answer: this would cause a heavy loss to speculators in certificates
payment was guaranteed in the Constitution
creditors would favor new federal gov't and its new powers
the states unanimously favored such a policy

questions.question: Hamilton's financial program was designed to do all of the following, EXCEPT

choices.answer: gain support from commercial classes for the new federal gov't
encourage the rapid industrialization of the U.S.
pay off the national debt as quickly as possible
establish the credit of the U.S. at home and abroad

questions.question: Hamilton's national bank

choices.answer: provoked 1st argument over strict vs. loose interpretation
was fully gov't owned and operated
helped U.S. retire its war debt as quickly as possible
all of the above

questions.question: The XYZ Affair

choices.answer: arose because of French gov't demanding a bribe for negotiating
increased popularity of the Republican party
provoked by Hamilton to increase popularity of Washington
arose out of the Whiskey Rebellion

questions.question: The Virginia and Kentucky Resolutions

choices.answer: attacked the Alien and Sedition Acts
were written by Madison and Jefferson
claimed the right of states to protect its people  from laws
all of the above

questions.question: Speculators were able to take advantage of which of these Federalists measures?

choices.answer: the excise tax
refunding national debt by paying off war bonds full price
the tariff
placing federal capital on land donated by VA and MD

questions.question: Which of these people would probably NOT be a supporter of Jefferson's Republican party?

choices.answer: a VA planter
a Boston merchant
a western PA farmer
a recent Irish immigrant

questions.question: Which of the following scored a victory over the Indians that opened Ohio to white settlement

choices.answer: Gabriel Prosser
Anthony Wayne
Stephen Girard
Matthew Lyon

questions.question: Which was NOT a weakness of the Articles of Confederation?

choices.answer: No chief executive
all states had to approve amendments
9 out of 13 had to approve laws
Congress could raise money by asking states for $

questions.question: Which event best shows the weakness of the Articles of Confederation?

choices.answer: Shay's Rebellion
Whiskey Rebellion
Stono Uprising
KY and VA Resolutions

questions.question: What was the outcome of Pickney's Treaty?

choices.answer: Canada and U.S. agreed to a mutual disarmament
The U.S. could now trade at New Orleans
British left the forts in the Northwest
Native Americans were banned from the Midwest

questions.question: Why did Washington want the nation to avoid foreign entanglements?

choices.answer: The US was ill-equipped to fight a war
Protect the US from England
Play France off against England
Placate Napoleon so we could purchase Louisiana

questions.question: What was NOT a foreign policy under Washington?

choices.answer: Proclamation of Neutrality
XYZ Affair
Jay's Treaty
Treaty Greenville

questions.question: Under the A of C how many states were needed to pass a new law?

choices.answer: 4 most populated states

questions.question: The 4th Amendment was a result of what?

choices.answer: strict libel laws
Courts of Admiralty
Quartering Act
Supporting the Church of England

questions.question: What was not part of Hamilton's Financial Plan?

choices.answer: Established the National Bank
Put the capital in Washington D.C.
Levying of excise taxes and tariffs
Assumption of state debts

questions.question: The Stamp Act Congress was significant because it

choices.answer: demonstrated the colonists were loyal to England
Repealed the Stamp Act
Led directly to the 1st Continental Congress
Marked an important step toward the unity of the colonies

questions.question: Election of 1800 illustrated what?

choices.answer: The Constitution needed to be reformed
US could peacefully transfer power from political parties
There was NO need for a two party system
Washington was no longer a hero

questions.question: The Judiciary Act of 1789

choices.answer: created the federal court system
established the principal of judicial review
Designated the Supreme Court to hear issues w/ federal gov't
established the Attorney General

questions.question: What did the Northwest Ordinance do?

choices.answer: prohibited the extension of slavery in the NW territory
settled the land dispute between Canada and US
Ended British control over the Ohio Valley
Prevented slavery north of the 36-30 latitude

questions.question: Washington's actions in the Whiskey Rebellion in 1794 demonstrated what?

choices.answer: the federal gov't control of the production of whiskey
the federal gov't prohibition of liquor
the federal gov't could enforce the laws of the land
suspension of habeas corpus

questions.question: The Great Compromise

choices.answer: established the executive branch
established the judicial branch
established the legislative branch
stated slaves would be counted as 3/5 of the population

questions.question: The Battle of Saratoga was a turning point in the war because

choices.answer: It prevented England from taking NYC
showed the colonists could fight more than guerilla wars
displayed Washington as a war hero
effectively destroyed English military power in the colonies

questions.question: How did most women contribute to the cause during the American Revolution?

choices.answer: Served in the Continental Army as soldiers
Formed Committees of Correspondence
Collected $, medicine, and food to supply the army
Petitioned to give women the right to vote

questions.question: After 1777, the British decided to focus their efforts in the South because

choices.answer: there was less population there
they believed there were more Loyalists there
they thought slaves would help them
they had more Indian allies there

questions.question: The "shot heard 'round the world" was which battle?

choices.answer: Bunker Hill
Saratoga
Trenton
Lexington and Concord

questions.question: How did the former German General von Steuben help the Americans?

choices.answer: shared British secrets
made a huge donation to the American Revolution cause
helped to form an alliance with France
trained the soldiers to march and fire guns quickly
